title: Srimad Bhagavatam - Canto 1 Chapter 1 | Kids Quiz (15Q)

questions.prompt: 1. Who does the Bhagavatam say is the original cause of everything?
choices: Nature itself
Brahma, the first created being
Lord Krishna, the son of Vasudeva
The sun god
questions.feedback: Yes! Krishna is the original source of everything. Even Brahma, who creates within the universe, got his knowledge from Krishna. Krishna is supreme!

questions.prompt: 2. How did Brahma get Vedic knowledge?
choices: He read it in ancient books
He figured it out by thinking really hard
Krishna put it directly into his heart
He learned it from other gods
questions.feedback: Correct! Brahma didn't figure it out himself. Krishna put the knowledge right into Brahma's heart. Real spiritual knowledge comes from Krishna, not from our own guessing!

questions.prompt: 3. The Bhagavatam says it completely rejects what kind of religion?
choices: Religion practiced by children
Any religion with rituals
Religion practiced to get money or enjoy ourselves
Religion that involves chanting
questions.feedback: Exactly! The Bhagavatam rejects religion done for selfish reasons like getting rich or having fun. Real religion means loving Krishna without wanting anything back!

questions.prompt: 4. Who can understand the highest truth according to SB 1.1.2?
choices: People born in religious families
Only very old people with lots of experience
People who are pure in heart and not envious
Only the smartest people with many degrees
questions.feedback: Right! What matters is having a pure, kind heart without jealousy—not how smart you are or what family you're from. Even kids can understand if their hearts are pure!

questions.prompt: 5. The Bhagavatam is compared to what kind of fruit?
choices: The ripened fruit from the tree of Vedic knowledge
A green banana that needs time to ripen
A perfectly ripe mango from the Vedic tree
An apple from a magic garden
questions.feedback: Yes! It's the perfectly ripe, sweet fruit from the Vedic knowledge tree. It's the very best, most delicious part! And it came from Sukadeva Gosvami's lips, making it even more tasty!

questions.prompt: 6. Why were the sages performing a thousand-year sacrifice at Naimisaranya?
choices: To defeat their enemies
To please the Lord and His devotees
To get material wealth
To become famous and powerful
questions.feedback: Perfect! They wanted to make Krishna and His devotees happy—not to get stuff for themselves. That's what real devotional service means!

questions.prompt: 7. Suta Gosvami studied the scriptures in what way?
choices: By listening to public speakers in parks
All by himself without any help
Through magical dreams
Under proper guidance from qualified teachers
questions.feedback: Correct! Suta learned from real teachers who knew the truth. We can't learn spiritual things just by reading alone—we need a qualified guru to guide us!

questions.prompt: 8. What special quality made Suta Gosvami's teachers give him all their knowledge?
choices: He was humble and submissive to his teachers
He paid them lots of money
He performed severe austerities
He was the smartest student
questions.feedback: Yes! Suta was humble and respectful to his spiritual masters. That's the secret—being a good listener and showing respect opens the door to real knowledge!

questions.prompt: 9. How does the Bhagavatam describe people in Kali-yuga (our age)?
choices: Physically strong and healthy
Short-lived, quarrelsome, lazy, and always disturbed
Spiritually advanced and saintly
Smart, peaceful, and happy
questions.feedback: Right! The Bhagavatam is honest—people in Kali-yuga have many problems. But don't worry! Krishna gives us an easy solution: hearing and chanting His holy names!

questions.prompt: 10. Even unconsciously chanting Krishna's name can do what?
choices: Free you from birth and death immediately
Give you magical powers
Nothing at all
Make you rich and famous
questions.feedback: Amazing but true! Even accidentally saying Krishna's name is so powerful it can free us from birth and death. The holy name is not ordinary sound—it's Krishna Himself!

questions.prompt: 11. Who can purify us faster: the Ganges river or pure devotees of Krishna?
choices: Pure devotees purify immediately; the Ganges takes longer
Both take the same amount of time
Neither can purify fallen souls
The Ganges purifies instantly
questions.feedback: Correct! Pure devotees are even more powerful than the holy Ganges. Why? Because devotees have Krishna in their hearts, while the Ganges only touched His feet. Association with devotees is super valuable!

questions.prompt: 12. Who enjoys hearing about Krishna at every moment?
choices: Only demigods in heaven
Only very old sages
People suffering from problems
Those who have developed a loving taste for Krishna
questions.feedback: Yes! When you develop a taste for Krishna, hearing about Him becomes the sweetest thing ever—like your favorite dessert! You'll want to hear more and more!

questions.prompt: 13. When Krishna appeared on earth, what did His human-like form allow Him to do?
choices: Avoid helping anyone
Perform superhuman acts while looking like a human
Prove He was not actually God
Hide from everyone completely
questions.feedback: Perfect! Krishna looked like a human boy so we could love Him as a friend, but He did superhuman things (like lifting mountains!) to show He's God. Best of both!

questions.prompt: 14. How did the sages say they met Suta Gosvami?
choices: By their own careful planning
Because Suta wanted to visit them
By pure accident with no reason
By the will of Providence (Krishna's arrangement)
questions.feedback: Right! They recognized Krishna arranged the meeting. When we're sincere about learning about Krishna, He helps us find the right teacher. Providence means Krishna's loving plan!

questions.prompt: 15. After Krishna left this world, the sages asked an important question: where did dharma (religious principles) go for shelter?
choices: Dharma disappeared completely
Dharma needs shelter in a person—Krishna Himself or His devotees
Dharma is just rules that don't need anyone
Dharma went to live in temples only
questions.feedback: Excellent! Dharma is not just rules—it needs a person to shelter it. When Krishna was present, dharma was with Him. After He left, dharma takes shelter in the Bhagavatam and in pure devotees who teach it. That's why we need gurus and scripture!
